issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The command seems defunct. Whatever I do, all I got is: 'ModifyImageAttribute'
object has no attribute 'adds'

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2011-07-26 22:20:25 by wenye

Tue Jul 26 15:20:25 2011: Request 2939 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by wen.ye
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: euca2ools: euca-modify-image-attribute not working
       Owner: wen.ye
  Requestors: wenye@eucalyptus.com
Organization: 
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 >


The command seems defunct. Whatever I do, all I got is:
'ModifyImageAttribute' object has no attribute 'adds'

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 22:22:24 by wenye

Tue Jul 26 15:22:24 2011: Request 2939 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Given to mitch.garnaat by wen.ye
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: euca2ools: euca-modify-image-attribute not working
       Owner: mitch.garnaat
  Requestors: wenye@eucalyptus.com
Organization: 
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 >


This transaction appears to have no content

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 23:27:53
On Tue Jul 26 15:20:25 2011, wen.ye wrote: > The command seems defunct.
Whatever I do, all I got is: > 'ModifyImageAttribute' object has no attribute
'adds' This was just a typo. Fixed in euca2ools-main rev 454. ---
euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py 2011-03-25 20:00:07 +0000 +++
euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py 2011-07-26 23:14:50 +0000 @@
-92,7 +92,7 @@ image_attribute = 'productCodes' if not image_attribute and
self.launchPermission: image_attribute = 'launchPermission' - if self.adds and
self.removes: + if self.add and self.remove: msg = 'You cannot add and remove
in the same call' self.display_error_and_exit(msg) if self.add:

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 23:27:54
According to our records, your request has been resolved. If you have any
further questions or concerns, please respond to this message.

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 23:27:54
On Tue Jul 26 15:20:25 2011, wen.ye wrote: > The command seems defunct.
Whatever I do, all I got is: > 'ModifyImageAttribute' object has no attribute
'adds' This was just a typo. Fixed in euca2ools-main rev 454. ---
euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py 2011-03-25 20:00:07 +0000 +++
euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py 2011-07-26 23:14:50 +0000 @@
-92,7 +92,7 @@ image_attribute = 'productCodes' if not image_attribute and
self.launchPermission: image_attribute = 'launchPermission' - if self.adds and
self.removes: + if self.add and self.remove: msg = 'You cannot add and remove
in the same call' self.display_error_and_exit(msg) if self.add:

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 23:27:54

<URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 >

On Tue Jul 26 15:20:25 2011, wen.ye wrote:
> The command seems defunct. Whatever I do, all I got is:
> 'ModifyImageAttribute' object has no attribute 'adds'

This was just a typo.  Fixed in euca2ools-main rev 454.

--- euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py	2011-03-25 20:00:07 +0000
+++ euca2ools/commands/euca/modifyimageattribute.py	2011-07-26 23:14:50 +0000
@@ -92,7 +92,7 @@
             image_attribute = 'productCodes'
         if not image_attribute and self.launchPermission:
             image_attribute = 'launchPermission'
-        if self.adds and self.removes:
+        if self.add and self.remove:
             msg = 'You cannot add and remove in the same call'
             self.display_error_and_exit(msg)
         if self.add:

Originally posted on 2011-07-26 23:48:48 by wenye
Still not working with product codes

  

root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-modify-image-attribute emi-2B81199E -p 111

local variable 'operation_type' referenced before assignment

> self.display_error_and_exit(msg)

<URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 >

Still not working with product codes

root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-modify-image-attribute emi-2B81199E -p 111
local variable 'operation_type' referenced before assignment

> On Tue Jul 26 15:20:25 2011, wen.ye wrote:

> > 'ModifyImageAttribute' object has no attribute 'adds'

Originally posted on 2011-07-27 00:22:45 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): On Tue Jul 26 16:48:48 2011, wen.ye wrote:
> Still not working with product codes > > root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-
modify-image-attribute emi-2B81199E -p 111 > local variable 'operation_type'
referenced before assignment The code appears to expect one to always specify
an attribute to add xor an attribute to remove, so I suspect it needs to
handle product codes with a slightly different code path. Mitch?

Originally posted on 2011-07-27 00:22:45
On Tue Jul 26 16:48:48 2011, wen.ye wrote: > Still not working with product
codes > > root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-modify-image-attribute emi-
2B81199E -p 111 > local variable 'operation_type' referenced before assignment
The code appears to expect one to always specify an attribute to add xor an
attribute to remove, so I suspect it needs to handle product codes with a
slightly different code path. Mitch?

Originally posted on 2011-08-02 12:37:23 by admin
On Tue Jul 26 17:22:45 2011, garrett.holmstrom wrote:

> On Tue Jul 26 16:48:48 2011, wen.ye wrote:

> > Still not working with product codes

> >

> > root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-modify-image-attribute emi-

> 2B81199E -p 111

> > local variable 'operation_type' referenced before assignment

>

> The code appears to expect one to always specify an attribute to add

> xor an attribute to remove, so I suspect it needs to handle product

> codes with a slightly different code path. Mitch?

  
This particular issue is resolved in revno 459.

  
Note, however, that boto is actually speaking an old version of the EC2
protocol for this request.  In particular, boto is using this version:

  
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-11-30/APIReference/ApiReference-
query-ModifyImageAttribute.html

  
But EC2 now speaks this version:

  
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-
query-ModifyImageAttribute.html

  
I should really update boto but I'm not sure if Eucalyptus supports the new
version of this request or not.  I'll hold off on any boto changes until we
resolve that.

Originally posted on 2011-08-02 12:37:24 by mitch.garnaat@eucalyptus.com

<URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=2939 >

On Tue Jul 26 17:22:45 2011, garrett.holmstrom wrote:
> On Tue Jul 26 16:48:48 2011, wen.ye wrote:
> > Still not working with product codes
> >
> > root@gushan:/opt/eucalyptus# euca-modify-image-attribute emi-
> 2B81199E -p 111
> > local variable 'operation_type' referenced before assignment
>
> The code appears to expect one to always specify an attribute to add
> xor an attribute to remove, so I suspect it needs to handle product
> codes with a slightly different code path. Mitch?

This particular issue is resolved in revno 459.

Note, however, that boto is actually speaking an old version of the EC2
protocol for this request. In particular, boto is using this version:

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-11-30/APIReference/ApiReference-query-ModifyImageAttribute.html

But EC2 now speaks this version:

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-ModifyImageAttribute.html

I should really update boto but I'm not sure if Eucalyptus supports the new
version of this request or not. I'll hold off on any boto changes until we
resolve that.

attribute to remove, so I suspect it needs to handle product > codes with a
slightly different code path. Mitch? This particular issue is resolved in
revno 459. Note, however, that boto is actually speaking an old version of the
EC2 protocol for this request. In particular, boto is using this version:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-11-30/APIReference/ApiReference-
query-ModifyImageAttribute.html But EC2 now speaks this version:
http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-
query-ModifyImageAttribute.html I should really update boto but I'm not sure
if Eucalyptus supports the new version of this request or not. I'll hold off
